title: ContentWriter
author: ContentWriter
created_time: July 09, 2024, 03:47:13 PMLast edit: July 09, 2024, 04:01:23 PM by ContentWriter
content: Being able to receive payments without the bank or anyone else knowing about it is what excites me about Bitcoin and crypto in general. Although it is sometimes discouraging when the tx fee is too high for Bitcoin, I don't really worry much because other cryptocurrencies, such as USDT and LTC, have stepped in to help me make or receive payments in such situations.I know nearly everyone here places Bitcoin head and shoulders above all other coins. For me, the crypto I loved best was Monero due to its privacy features. Unfortunately, it seems to be the digital asset that every government hates. To me, it is the next best after Bitcoin BTC.What do you like best about BTC and other coins? Which has been your favorite and second-best?

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: First off, I don't quite agree with those Bitcoin-only fanatics. There probably is a certain level of hypocrisy in their stand. Some of them are quick to use stablecoins when the fees are high. If there is no second best, then they wouldn't have resorted to the very altcoins they criticize day in and day out. For all we know, many of them are also using centralized Bitcoin services, a big betrayal of the very raison d'être of Bitcoin. Anyway, I can't say what's Bitcoin's second best because it might be a case-to-case basis. Monero is Bitcoin's second best if one gives weight to privacy. Litecoin could also be a second best if one is using crypto payments regularly. Ethereum is probably the second best for those who are developing projects.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: I personally put Monero and Bitcoin on just about the same level.  They can both be Payment Systems that work very well, but while Bitcoin is a Public Ledger that is only semi hated by the Governments, Monero is a Private Ledger that is completely hated by them.  On the plus side, you have a level of Privacy with Monero that you can not obtain from Bitcoin and Transaction Fees are so much lower.Besides these two, the rest of Altcoins are in my opinion only volatile experiments, Scams or speculative Assets.  None of them ever got to shine as well as Monero did to me so far.Quote from: Patikno on July 09, 2024, 06:13:54 PMNot afraid of losing value? Monero has been delisted on many large exchanges, which means that Monero will no longer get much attention in the market.I truly believe Monero may be used more as a Currency than Bitcoin is right now.  Monero is used mostly underground, which is to be very expected considering it is a Privacy Coin.  Whether Centralized Exchanges list it or not is in my opinion not a variable of how much attention it gets for the same reason.  I suppose most of us who use Monero are also using Bisq or testing Haveno and are avoiding Centralized Exchanges as much as we can.  More over, the hatred is to be expected and in my opinion nothing new.  We saw this hatred for years and it will likely never end any time soon.  For the reasons above, all the 'unfortunate happenings' related to Monero are I would say nothing to be afraid of as a user.In fact.  While I absolutely love Bitcoin and I always try as much as I can to use it as a Payment System, I found I Spend and Receive so much more often Peer to Peer using Monero.  I just think the Peer to Peer community of Monero is so much larger.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: ContentWriter on July 09, 2024, 03:47:13 PM-snip-What do you like best about BTC and other coins? Which has been your favorite and second-best?Let me start by answering the second question, Ethereum is my second best and it's for the obvious reason. There is nothing Bitcoin does that Ethereum doesn't do or try to do, and in some cases, it does more due to its scalability, so it's worth it. Even the market cap and its retainment for these long years should speak a lot in this regard.Regarding what I like best about Bitcoin, that will be the cross-border payment. The decentralization of Bitcoin has taken off the centrality and the partiality where the top-world countries will always have the best services and find ways to disenfranchise the developing/developed ones. It was hurtful when I wasn't able to fund my Forex accounts with my preferred brokers easily before Bitcoin was introduced, but had to painstakingly use the bank wire option in those days. This option will force my account to be credited in an average of 3 days and still have to part ways with an average of $38 as the processing fee. Thanks to Bitcoin, that's no more.

comments.author: Marvell1
comments.body: Quote from: ContentWriter on July 09, 2024, 03:47:13 PMWhat do you like best about BTC and other coins? Which has been your favorite and second-best?The profits are what attracted me to bitcoin, but over time, what I've come to love about bitcoin is its decentralized nature. Thanks to bitcoin, I feel more secure in having full control over my assets without having to rely on a third party, as well as storing them quite easily and conveniently, not as cumbersome as gold and fiat. For my portfolio, bitcoin makes up the majority because it is safer and the rest are some altcoins including memes. I don't differentiate between altcoins because I don't intend to hold them long term and for me they are for short to medium term speculative purposes only. I invest based on their potential and when I reach my goal, I have no reason to continue holding. In short, my top and only long-term choice is bitcoin, there is no second choice.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: What I like best about Bitcoin is its ability to enable payments without the need for banks or intermediaries, ensuring privacy and control over my finances. I understand the frustration with high transaction fees, but I'm relieved that other cryptocurrencies like USDT offer alternatives for more cost-effective transactions.Personally, I can't say I have favorites because I can't take sides! Each cryptocurrency offers unique features and caters to different needs. Bitcoin is the granddaddy of them all, with a massive user base and established reputation. However, there's a lot of innovation happening with other projects, so it's exciting to see how the crypto landscape continues to evolve.
